definition: negative score/minus (in grades, such as A-)
to bear/to carry (on one's back)/to turn one's back on/to be defeated/negative (math. etc)
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: The weakest students can end up with a negative score.
sentences.chinese: 最差的学生可能会以负分收场。

sentences.english: But I can't give you a negative number.
sentences.chinese: 但是我不能给你个负分啊。

definition: poor evaluation/adverse criticism
to fail/to flunk
(Internet slang) I can't even.../Are you kidding me!/OMG!
low marks/low score
to pass an exam or a test/to meet a minimum standard
(Internet slang) to post a photo of oneself online
someone who attaches great importance to good looks (esp. in others)
ugly people will do all kinds of weird things to get attention (idiom)
aw, fuck! (loanword from Korean 아! 씨발!)
euphemistic equivalent of 他媽的|他妈的[ta1 ma1 de5]
to stop one's pen/to break off writing/final remarks (at the end of a book or article)
life is hard enough as it is; don't burst my bubble (Internet slang)
(lit.) so exhausted (by difficulties in a relationship) that one feels one could never fall in love again (Internet slang)/disenchanted with sth
straight guy
slag (in mining or smelting)/dregs
